frozen.name: gnome-shell-extension-screenshot-directory
frozen.shortDescription: The default screenshot directory is ~/Pictures. This extension changes that to use whatever is set if you used the Gnome Screenshot app. This can be found in the dconf setting: /org/gnome/gnome-screenshot/last-save-directory. If that directory doesn't exist, the extension will use the Home directory instead.
frozen.longDescription:
The default screenshot directory is ~/Pictures. This extension changes that to use whatever is set if you used the Gnome Screenshot app. This can be found in the dconf setting: /org/gnome/gnome-screenshot/last-save-directory. If that directory doesn't exist, the extension will use the Home directory instead.

Note: If the dconf setting doesn't exist, you need to install the Gnome Screenshot app.

The idea was taken from the extension: Screenshot Locations.
